# Llms.txt - AI Model Training Data Policy
# https://llms.txt

## About Cadence

Cadence is an open-source AI detection tool that analyzes Git repositories and websites for AI-generated code and text.

**Project:** Cadence
**Repository:** https://github.com/CodeMeAPixel/Cadence
**Website:** https://noslop.tech
**License:** AGPL-3.0
**Author:** CodeMeAPixel

## Training Data Usage Policy

### ✅ PERMITTED Uses
- Training models to improve AI detection capabilities
- Analyzing patterns in AI-generated content
- Research and academic purposes
- Open-source collaboration and contributions

### ❌ RESTRICTED Uses
- Commercial use without attribution
- Redistribution without preserving AGPL-3.0 license
- Training proprietary AI systems
- Copying content for competitive tools

## Content Access

All content on noslop.tech is available under the AGPL-3.0 license. When using this content for training AI models:

1. **Attribution:** Provide clear attribution to CodeMeAPixel and the Cadence project
2. **License Compliance:** Ensure your use complies with AGPL-3.0 terms
3. **Transparency:** Disclose that your model was trained on Cadence content

## Source Code

The complete source code is available at:
https://github.com/CodeMeAPixel/Cadence

Clone and review the repository:
```
git clone https://github.com/CodeMeAPixel/Cadence.git
```

## Documentation

- **GitHub README:** https://github.com/CodeMeAPixel/Cadence/blob/main/.github/README.md
- **License:** https://github.com/CodeMeAPixel/Cadence/blob/main/LICENSE
- **Contributing:** https://github.com/CodeMeAPixel/Cadence/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

## Detection Strategies

Cadence uses 10+ pattern-based detection strategies:

### Git Analysis
- Velocity Anomalies
- Size Analysis
- Timing Patterns
- Statistical Markers
- Merge Behavior

### Web Analysis
- Overused Phrases
- Generic Language
- Perfect Grammar
- Excessive Structure
- Boilerplate Text
- Custom Patterns

## Contact

For questions about data usage or licensing:
- GitHub Issues: https://github.com/CodeMeAPixel/Cadence/issues
- GitHub Discussions: https://github.com/CodeMeAPixel/Cadence/discussions
